intro: Martensianthus albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower martensia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
